abstract: Yemen's Houthi minority are enjoying newfound place of prominence following rebel takeover of capital Sana, transforming from fringe group to legitimate movement that is beginning to draw support from country's Sunni Muslim majority; question remains as to whether group will be able to unite country long divided by sectarian tensions.
lead_paragraph: The Houthis see themselves now as having evolved from rebels into a broad-based voice against government oppression, corruption and incompetence.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington, and Shuaib Almosawa from Sana.

snippet: The Houthis see themselves now as having evolved from rebels into a broad-based voice against government oppression, corruption and incompetence.

keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: Houthis Reach Out as They Cement Power in Yemen
headline.print_headline: Houthis Reach Out as They Cement Power in Yemen
